messages.page_content:
- Topic: Zoning Change and Conditional Use for Bar Expansion
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to change zoning from HU-RD2 Historic Urban Two-Family Residential District to HU-MU Historic Urban Neighborhood Mixed-Use District and allow the expansion of an existing bar up to 10,000 square feet. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33588 - 28937 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Conditional Use, Bar Expansion, Historic Urban District, Municipal Address
- UID: 48876fd5-d739-42ae-93b2-a5c747a0f8dc

- Topic: Conditional Use for Accessory Off-Street Parking Lot
- Summary: This ordinance sought to permit an accessory off-street parking lot in an HUC Historic Urban Corridor Use Restriction Overlay District. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33599 - 28938 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Off-Street Parking Lot, Historic Urban Corridor, Municipal Address
- UID: 48876fd5-d739-42ae-93b2-a5c747a0f8dc

- Topic: Zoning Change from C-1 to C-3 Commercial District
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to change zoning from a C-1 General Commercial District to a C-3 Heavy Commercial District. The ordinance was adopted.

- Votes Summary:

- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Change, Commercial District, Municipal Address
- UID: 48876fd5-d739-42ae-93b2-a5c747a0f8dc

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Establishment of City Council SWBNO Substation Support Fund
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish the City Council SWBNO Substation Support Fund and add it as Division 48 of Article III in Section 70 of the Code of the City of New Orleans. The Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee recommended approval, and it was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33617
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted and added as Division 48 of Article III in Section 70 of the Code of the City of New Orleans.
- Tags/Keywords: City Council, SWBNO Substation Support Fund, Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee
- UID: bb2caf98-17db-4061-80df-12202496ad57

- Topic: Appropriation of American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) funds for SWBNO substation
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to appropriate ARPA funds provided to the City of New Orleans for the funding of a CEA between the City of New Orleans and SWBNO for the building and development of a new substation. The Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee recommended approval, and it was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33618
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted for the appropriation of ARPA funds for the SWBNO substation project.
- Tags/Keywords: ARPA funds, SWBNO substation, Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee
- UID: bb2caf98-17db-4061-80df-12202496ad57

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for ARPA funds appropriation
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend the Operating Budget of Expenditures for the City of New Orleans to appropriate ARPA funds for the funding of a CEA between the City of New Orleans and SWBNO for the building and development of a new substation. The Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee recommended approval, and it was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33619
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted to amend the Operating Budget for the appropriation of ARPA funds for the SWBNO substation project.
- Tags/Keywords: Operating Budget, ARPA funds, SWBNO substation, Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee
- UID: bb2caf98-17db-4061-80df-12202496ad57

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Redesignation of Polling Locations
- Summary: The ordinance aims to redesignate polling locations in the Parish of Orleans to reflect the change of street names. This includes changing the polling location from Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Charter School on 1617 Caffin Ave. to Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Charter School on 1617 Fats Domino Ave. for precincts 9/04, 9/05, and 9/06.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-98
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to redesignate the polling locations was adopted.
- UID: e5c3ef3b-6229-4a08-b119-58c06a1e00f8

- Topic: Amendment of Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: The ordinance directs the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance of the City of New Orleans. This includes incorporating Phase 1 proposals outlined in the Outdoor Live Entertainment Study, such as expanding the allowed number of temporary outdoor entertainment events and zoning districts for outdoor amphitheaters.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-111
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Not specified in the provided information
- Decision/Key Actions: No specific voting outcome provided in the summary guidelines
- UID: e5c3ef3b-6229-4a08-b119-58c06a1e00f8
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 2-17-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Outdoor Amusement Facilities and Live Entertainment Use Standards
- Summary: The ordinance clarifies and revises the use standards and use charts for live entertainment - secondary use, including the addition of "spiritual events" and "incidental" outdoor live entertainment. It also expands live entertainment secondary use within Arts & Cultural Overlay Districts and ancillary uses of hotel operations to include outdoor live entertainment.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-111
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without any amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Outdoor Amusement Facilities, Live Entertainment, Use Standards
- UID: 73ceb437-5a55-473b-aecc-06a27632c59b

Overall, the ordinance related to outdoor amusement facilities and live entertainment use standards passed with a unanimous vote and without any amendments. The ordinance aims to clarify and revise the guidelines for live entertainment secondary use and introduce expanded uses within specific districts.
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 2-17-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Support for Redistricting Outcomes
- Summary: Resolution to express Council support for redistricting outcomes that maintain the same number of majority minority Louisiana Senate seats in New Orleans and support the expansion of district seats in the Louisiana House of Representatives for New Orleans according to net gains of representation which reflect population growth, while maintaining currently allotted majority minority seats.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-113
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Council expressed support for redistricting outcomes.
- Tags/Keywords: Redistricting, Louisiana Senate, Louisiana House of Representatives, Majority Minority Seats
- UID: 1ca5b865-ddb5-4ba4-9856-b7c638421565

- Topic: DBE Classification for Formerly Incarcerated
- Summary: Motion providing regulations promulgated for a Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (DBE) classification for formerly incarcerated individuals.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-114
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 3/10/22
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was continued to a future meeting for further discussion.
- Tags/Keywords: DBE, Formerly Incarcerated, Regulations
- UID: 1ca5b865-ddb5-4ba4-9856-b7c638421565
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 2-17-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Zoning Ordinance Amendment for Cemetery Use
- Summary: The ordinance aims to classify "cemetery" as a permitted use in the MU-1 Medium Intensity Mixed-Use District citywide. The motion to suspend the rules and introduce the ordinance on first reading passed unanimously.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,626
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to suspend the rules and introduce the ordinance on first reading passed unanimously.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Cemetery Use, MU-1 District, Ordinance
- UID: efd685b1-6ad7-4caf-9383-cdcae6df0851

- Topic: Zoning Change from BIP to S-RS District
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to effect a zoning change from a Business Industrial Park District to a Single-Family Residential District in specific areas in the Third Municipal District. The motion to introduce the ordinance on first reading passed unanimously.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,627
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to introduce the ordinance on first reading passed unanimously.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Change, BIP, S-RS District, Ordinance
- UID: efd685b1-6ad7-4caf-9383-cdcae6df0851

- Topic: Zoning Change from S-B1 to S-RS District
- Summary: The ordinance aims to effect a zoning change from a Suburban Business District to a Suburban Single-Family Residential District in a specific area in the Third Municipal District. The motion to introduce the ordinance on first reading passed unanimously.
- Ordinance Number: CAL NO. 33,628
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to introduce the ordinance on first reading passed unanimously.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Change, S-B1, S-RS District, Ordinance
- UID: efd685b1-6ad7-4caf-9383-cdcae6df0851

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 2-17-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: Councilmember Harris introduced an ordinance to amend and reordain Articles 7, 15, 16, 20, and 26 of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to create a new use category of "convenience center" and establish site design and use standards.
- Ordinance Number: 33633
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Ordinance, Convenience Center, Site Design, Use Standards
- UID: 7f00ba9e-2362-4e7f-9333-4d30cf643981

- Topic: Appropriation of State Grant Funds
- Summary: Councilmember Giarrusso introduced an ordinance to appropriate state grant funds from Intergovernmental Transfers to the Mayor's Office of Workforce Development for the 2021 National Disaster Dislocated Worker grant program.
- Ordinance Number: 33634
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (9 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with unanimous support.
- Tags/Keywords: State Grant Funds, Workforce Development, National Disaster Dislocated Worker Grant Program
- UID: 7f00ba9e-2362-4e7f-9333-4d30cf643981

- Topic: Appropriation of Federal Dislocated Worker Funds
- Summary: Councilmember Giarrusso introduced an ordinance to appropriate Federal Dislocated Worker Funds awarded by the State of Louisiana to the City of New Orleans for the Workforce Development Subrecipient Area affected by Hurricane Ida.
- Ordinance Number: 33635
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Federal Dislocated Worker Funds, Workforce Development, Hurricane Ida
- UID: 7f00ba9e-2362-4e7f-9333-4d30cf643981

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 2-17-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for the Lafitte Greenway
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City of New Orleans, the NORD, and Friends of Lafitte Greenway for the public purpose of maximizing the Lafitte Greenway for public recreational use. The ordinance was electronically submitted and was moved by Giarrusso and seconded by Green. The meeting was adjourned with 5 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: 33640
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed, authorizing the Mayor to enter into the Cooperative Endeavor Agreement.
- UID: 8aaf4173-4d88-44de-a412-89e2b97a3091
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 2-17-2022
